description: a(0)=1, then twice the Fibonacci sequence.
comments: a(n) is the number of sequences on {0,1} such that all maximal blocks (of both 0's and 1's) have odd length. - Geoffrey Critzer, Mar 06 2012
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,1).
example: a(4) = 6 because we have 0001, 0101, 0111, 1000, 1010, 1110. - Geoffrey Critzer, Mar 06 2012
mathematica: Join[{1}, Table[2*Fibonacci[n], {n, 70}]] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Feb 10 2012 *)
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 05 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Jul 07 2000
